content.description:
The first route at Above It All follows finger and hand cracks to the top of the wall.

P1. Start up the detached boulder, head left past a bolt, and make your way to a handcrack.
(5.8, 1 bolt, 20m)

P2. Climb cracks and flakes through the steep wall. Hidden jugs on both sides keep the
grade reasonable. (10c, 6 bolts, 25m)

P3. Climb the sweet splitter through a cool undercling crux. Where it ends before a tree,
step right and up to the anchor. (10c, 30m)

P4. Follow the curving flake above and face climb past two bolts. Step right at the third to
gain a fun crack and follow it through the steepening wall to the top. (10a, 3 bolts, 35m)

Rap the route with a single 70m

Start on the belay platform below a detached boulder
.2 - 3, (2x) .3 - 1 BD, nuts
Pleasant crack and face climbing with a great view of Howe Sound. The wall gets full sun after 2pm, with the bottom staying shady. Fairly quick to dry.
